column2:
mini %>% 
  mutate(count = 1) %>%
  mutate(e_01 = case_when(e_01 == 1 ~ "wooden_house", 
                          e_01 == 2 ~ "bamboo", 
                          e_01 == 3 ~ "semi_pacca_house", 
                          e_01 == 4 ~ "bungalow_brick_house",
                          e_01 == 5 ~ "apartment_condominium", 
                          e_01 == 6 ~ "hut_2_3_years", 
                          e_01 == 7 ~ "hut_1_year", 
                          TRUE ~ "other")) %>%
  select(e_01, state, count) %>% 
  group_by(state, e_01) %>% 
  summarise(count = n()) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = e_01, 
              values_from = count, 
              values_fill = 0) %>% 
  mutate(n = wooden_house +
           bamboo +
           semi_pacca_house + 
           bungalow_brick_house + 
           apartment_condominium + 
           hut_2_3_years + 
           hut_1_year + 
           other) %>% 
  mutate_at(c("apartment_condominium", 
                 "bungalow_brick_house", 
                 "semi_pacca_house", 
                 "wooden_house",
                 "bamboo", 
                 "hut_2_3_years",
                 "hut_1_year",
                 "other"), 
               ~ round(.x / n * 100, 
                       digits = 2))
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'state'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
